oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Increased Risk of Non-pregnancy Associated with Neospora caninum Infection in Western Canadian Beef Herds
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Waldner, C. L.
Cunningham, G. L.
Janzen, E. D.
Campbell, J. R.
Henderson, J.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: N. caninum
abortion
abortion storm
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The first study examined long-term impact of a N. caninum-associated abortion outbreak in a large northern Alberta cow-calf herd. Blood samples were collected three times from all bred females and from heifer calves born the spring before the outbreak (average age 7-9 months). These blood samples were collected (1) at the time of the outbreak, (2) the following spring, and (3) again the subsequent fall.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; 2000; 151
